name: XO-5
scenarioDescription:
The XO-5 Exoplanetary System


Overview

XO-5 is a star with 1.04 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.13 times its radius. It is located 907.92 light years away from the solar system.

XO-5 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the XO-5 system


XO-5 b

XO-5 b was discovered by the XO observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of XO-5 b is 378.41999999999996 times the mass of Earth. The radius of XO-5 b is 12.78 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, XO-5 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system XO-5, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by XO.
